App.Title: Video Duplicate Finder - Cross-platform
QualityOrderDialog.Title: Select the order of quality criteria
QualityOrderDialog.Description: Please arrange the quality criteria in order of priority (highest quality first)
ThumbnailComparerDialog.SelectTwoElement: Please select two items first to use this mode.
DuplicateList.FilePath.Tooltip.OpenInExp: Double click to open the file in explorer/shell
DuplicateList.Thumbnail.Tooltip.OpenFile: Double click to open the file

ChooseAlgo.Title: Initial Setup
ChooseAlgo.Description: Please choose your graybyte database format. You cannot switch between them later on. The only way is to delete the entire database and start from scratch. Both use visual similarity frame check as default algorithm. In both cases you can find duplicates even if different resolution, added watermark, changes to fps / bitrate etc
ChooseAlgo.Option16Details:
‚Ä¢ Fastest
‚Ä¢ More false positives
‚Ä¢ pHash algorithm is NOT available
ChooseAlgo.Option32Details:
‚Ä¢ Slower than 16x16 (theoretically 4x slower but practically in most cases +40-60% additional scan time)
‚Ä¢ Less false positives
‚Ä¢ pHash algorithm is available. More robust when duplicates differ due to changes in contrast, brightness, scaling, or minor edits (but not automatically better, it just works differently)
‚Ä¢ When a video is first added to the database, pHash signature is automatically generated, making the initial scan slower. On subsequent rescans, you can switch between both algorithms with negligible performance cost, enabling highly efficient duplicate detection
ChooseAlgo.FoldersHint: Optional. You can add folders now or skip and do it later in Settings.
CustomSelection.Title: Custom Selection
CustomSelection.IgnoreGroupsWithSelected: Ignore groups which contain selected items
While active any group which contain at least one selected item will be ignored
CustomSelection.WildcardRequired: Please add a wildcard (*) at the end of the path so partial matches work.
CustomSelection.WildcardNote: Note: Supports the following wildcards: '*' and '?'. The backslash character '\' escapes.
DatabaseViewer.Title: Database Editor
ExpressionBuilder.Title: Expression Builder
MainWindow.ContextMenu.DeleteFromDiskRec: Delete from disk (to recycle bin if possible)
MainWindow.ContextMenu.MarkNotMatchToolt: Hides this group and exclude it from future scans, except when there is a new duplicate.
MainWindow.ContextMenu.RemoveFromListAnd: Remove from list only and exclude from future scans
Remove from list only + create symbol links
MainWindow.ContextMenu.RemoveFromListSym: Remove from list only + create symbol links + exclude
MainWindow.ContextMenu.SymbolLinkTooltip: Links all selected items to the first unselected item in each group.
MainWindow.EmptyState.Subtitle: Click ‚ÄúScan‚Äù in the toolbar to begin.
MainWindow.EmptyState.Title: Please start your first scan
MainWindow.Filter.Note: Note: Any action (select, delete etc) will only apply on filtered duplicates
MainWindow.Filter.PathNote: Note: if only one item of a group is matching, all group items will be shown
MainWindow.Filter.Title: Filter / Sort
MainWindow.Settings.AlwaysRetryFailedSam: If activated scan engine will try to generate thumbprints of failed entries each time it is run. Otherwise consecutive attempt will be taken only after cleanup of the database.
MainWindow.Settings.AutoBackupScanResult: If activated a backup gets created each time the scan results list gets changed
MainWindow.Settings.CompareHorizontallyF: Select this option if your video collection might contain horizontally flipped videos and you want them to be detected reliably. Slows down the scan speed by a bit.
MainWindow.Settings.CustomCommandsPlaceh: E.g.: 'nemo --tabs %f', where '%f' is the placeholder for the file(s)
MainWindow.Settings.CustomCommandsToolti: Enter your own commands to open single or multiple files.
MainWindow.Settings.CustomDatabaseFolder: Specify a custom database folder. Otherwise it uses the current VDF folder.
MainWindow.Settings.CustomFFArgumentsToo: FF(mpeg/probe) arguments passed to the end of the internal arguments. Most users can leave this empty.
MainWindow.Settings.DragDropHint: Hint: You can also add folders with drag & drop
MainWindow.Settings.DurationDifferenceTo: Only scan videos against each other where the duration is not bigger/smaller than X %
MainWindow.Settings.DurationDifferenceMi: Clamp the percent-based duration difference to at least this many seconds (0 = disable).
MainWindow.Settings.DurationDifferenceMa: Clamp the percent-based duration difference to at most this many seconds (0 = disable).
MainWindow.Settings.MaxSamplingDurationS: If a video is longer, only the first X seconds are used for sampling (0 = disable).
MainWindow.Settings.ExcludeHardLinksTool: Unlike reparse points hard links are still included in search but are not considered as duplicates. WARNING: Use this option only when necessary, as it slows down the scanning process considerably!
MainWindow.Settings.ExcludeReparsePoints: Symbolic links and junction only. Note this will completely skip these from file enumeration to search.
MainWindow.Settings.ExtendedFFToolsLoggi: If activated ffmpeg and ffprobe errors will be written to the log
MainWindow.Settings.FilesNote: Note: These settings apply when files are added to database, not when comparing files against duplicates
MainWindow.Settings.GeneratePreviewImage: Deactivate to save memory by disabling preview images of duplicates
MainWindow.Settings.IgnoreBlackPixelsToo: Skip black pixels when comparing thumbnails. Lowers the chance for 'false positives' if thumbnails contain too much dark and raises the chance to detect duplicates if one of the thumbnails have black bars and the others not. In rare scenarios this might raise the 'false positives' instead. Slows down the scan speed by a bit.
MainWindow.Settings.IgnoreWhitePixelsToo: Skip white pixels when comparing thumbnails. Lowers the chance for 'false positives' if thumbnails contain too much brightness and raises the chance to detect duplicates if one of the thumbnails have white bars and the others not. In rare scenarios this might raise the 'false positives' instead. Slows down the scan speed by a bit.
MainWindow.Settings.LogExcludedFilesTool: Log when files are excluded from the scan and why (limited to avoid log spam).
MainWindow.Settings.MaxDegreeOfParalleli: Limits the amount of concurrent tasks. A value of -1 leaves it up to the system to decide (takes full speed), a value of 1 is most stable (lets you interact with your system while scan runs in background). Maximum should be the amount of physical cores of your CPU.
MainWindow.Settings.MiscHint: Hint: Mouse hover options to get more information about them
MainWindow.Settings.PercentTooltip: Minimum percentage that thumbnails must match before they are considered duplicates
MainWindow.Settings.SaveResultsOnExitToo: If checked you will be asked if you want to save the results when you close VDF
MainWindow.Settings.SaveTooltip: Note: Settings are automatically saved on normal exit
MainWindow.Settings.ScanAgainstEntireDat: If checked scan is also performed against your entire database unless database files are excluded otherwise (i.e. exclude list, file path must contain, etc)
MainWindow.Settings.ScanAgainstNonExisti: If checked non-existing files which have all necessary information are included
MainWindow.Settings.ThumbnailsTooltip: Number of thumbnails generated per file. This only applies to video files. A high number means that the scan takes longer but also the chance of a 'false positive' decreases.
MainWindow.Settings.UseExifCreationDate: Use EXIF Creation Date for Images
MainWindow.Settings.UseExifCreationDateT: Read creation date from EXIF metadata (DateTimeOriginal) instead of file system date. Useful when file creation date is not accurate.
MainWindow.Settings.UseNativeFfmpegBindi: If activated it will call ffmpeg functions natively instead of spawning a new ffmpeg.exe process. This is MUCH(!!) faster. WARNING: You must use the latest SHARED and STABLE ffmpeg version. If something goes wrong then whole VDF will crash.
MainWindow.Settings.UsePHashing: Use pHash instead of visual similarity
MainWindow.Settings.UsePHashingTooltip: pHash = slower but more robust to re-encoding, resizing, contrast changes etc. Visual similarity = faster, also works on reencoded videos, watermarks etc but less robust. Ignored if you're using an old database with 16x16 graybyte values.
MainWindow.Settings.WildcardNote: Note: Supports the following wildcards: '*' and '?'. The backslash character '\' escapes.
MainWindow.Tooltip.CleanDatabase: Removes entries which file no longer exists or which failed on ffmpeg/ffprobe
MainWindow.Tooltip.Rescan: Re-run the scan but without enumerating and gathering file informations. Changing certain settings will only take effect during a full scan.
Message.CommandNotImplemented: Requested command is NOT implemented yet!
Message.CopyFailed: Failed to copy some files. Please check log!
Message.CustomDatabaseFolderMissing: The custom database folder does not exist!
Message.DiscardResultsPrompt: Do you want to discard the results and start a new scan?
Message.ExportDatabaseFailed: Exporting database has failed, please see log
Message.FFprobeMissing: Cannot find FFprobe. Please follow instructions on Github and restart VDF
Message.FFprobeMissingWithHint: Cannot find FFprobe executable. The easiest solution is to download ffmpeg/ffprobe and place it in VDF 'bin' folder. Otherwise please follow instructions on Github and restart VDF
Message.FfmpegDownloadIoFailed: FFmpeg download/extraction failed (possibly blocked by antivirus): {0}
Message.FfmpegDownloadAccessFailed: FFmpeg download/extraction failed due to access permissions: {0}
Message.FfmpegDownloadUnsupported: Your OS/architecture is not supported by the automatic FFmpeg downloader.
Message.FfmpegDownloadVerified: FFmpeg and FFprobe were found after download.
Message.FfmpegDownloadMissing: FFmpeg and/or FFprobe are still missing after the download.
Message.FfmpegDownloadWindowsInfo: Windows: Ensure ffmpeg.exe, ffprobe.exe, and the FFmpeg DLLs are in the VDF 'bin' folder.
Message.FfmpegDownloadWindowsRestart: Restart VDF after placing the files in the bin folder.
Message.FfmpegDownloadStopApp: Please close VDF before installing FFmpeg on macOS/Linux.
Message.FfmpegDownloadMacPorts: MacPorts:  sudo port selfupdate && sudo port install ffmpeg
Message.FfmpegDownloadLinuxHeader: Linux (choose the command for your distribution):
Message.FfmpegDownloadLinuxDeb: Debian/Ubuntu:  sudo apt update && sudo apt install ffmpeg
Message.FileSizeFilterInvalid: Filtering maximum file size cannot be greater or equal minimum file size.
Message.ImportDatabaseFailed: Importing database has failed, please see log
Message.LoadDatabaseFailed: Failed to load database of scanned files. Please see log file in VDF directory
Message.MaxDegreeOfParallelismInvalid: MaxDegreeOfParallelism cannot be 0. Please go to the settings and change it.
Message.MoveFailed: Failed to move some files. Please check log!
Message.NativeFfmpegAutoNotSupported: You cannot use hardware acceleration mode 'auto' with native ffmpeg bindings. Please explicit set a mode or set it to 'none'.
Message.NoMatchingDuplicates: There is no duplicate item which matches your filter (if set) and which is checked
Message.NoScanFolders: There are no folders to scan. Please go to the settings and add at least one folder to 'Search Directories'.
Message.RescanConfirm: Are you sure to perform a rescan?
Message.RestartRequired: Please restart VDF to apply new settings.
Message.SaveResultsPrompt: Do you want to save the results and continue next time you start VDF?
Message.ClearAllExcludedConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear the list of ALL excluded folders?
Message.ClearAllIncludedConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear the list of ALL included folders?
RelocateFilesDialog.Title: Relocate Files
RelocateFilesDialog.ModePrefix: A) Moved everything to a new location
RelocateFilesDialog.NoteNoPath: Note: Files without a new path will remain untouched
ThumbnailComparerDialog.Title: Thumbnail Comparer
Log.InvalidScheduledScanTime: Scheduled scan time is invalid. Use HH:mm (e.g., 02:00).
Log.ScheduledScanSkippedMissingDatabaseF: Scheduled scan skipped: custom database folder does not exist.
Log.ScheduledScanSkippedWithResults: Scheduled scan skipped: existing results would be discarded.
Log.ScheduledScanSkippedMissingFfmpeg: Scheduled scan skipped: FFmpeg is missing.
Log.ScheduledScanSkippedMissingFfprobe: Scheduled scan skipped: FFprobe is missing.
Log.ScheduledScanSkippedNoFolders: Scheduled scan skipped: no scan folders configured.
MainWindow.Settings.ScheduledScanTimeToo: Time of day in HH:mm format (24h).
Message.ClearDatabaseWarning: WARNING: This will delete all stored data in your database. Do you want to continue?
Message.ExportScanResultsFailed: Exporting scan results has failed because of {0}
Message.ImportScanResultsClearConfirm: Importing scan results will clear the current list, continue?
Message.ImportScanResultsCorrupt: Importing scan results has failed because it's likely corrupted
Message.ImportScanResultsFailed: Importing scan results has failed because of {0}
